answers.answer: I know people and dogs can develop diabetes. Do you know if hamsters can too? Does his urine smell different or stronger (I wonder about kidney or bladder problems)?

Dwarf hamsters are very prone to diabetes and it sounds like that's what your hamster has.Check out this link for more information on how to manage it:http://www.hamsterific.com/HamsterUniversity/DwarfDiabetes.html

My Dwarf also had this problem. The poor little guy was basically spending 90% of his day drinking water. He was also loosing hair on his bellyl.  The vet suspected cushings disease.  I hated to do it but I put him to sleep.

question: My 10 month old male dwarf hamster has start waking regularly during the day to drink water. His water consumption has increased 4 fold. He looks well and otherwise his behaviour is normal. What should I do?
title: Dwarf hamster drinking problem
